```{r}
rm(list=ls())
setwd("~/WORKSHOP/EARTHSHINE_CODE")
#
df <- as.data.frame(read.csv("ratios.dat",sep=""))
colnames(df) <- c("rat_ideal","rat_folded")
idx <- which(df$rat_ideal > 10 | df$rat_ideal < 0.1)
df <- df[idx,]
```

#plots
```{r}
idx <- which(df$rat_ideal > 1)
plot(df[idx,],log="xy",pch=19,cex=0.5,ylim=c(10,5000),xlim=c(100,200000),main="Effect of folding on the BS-DS ratio")
abline(c(0,1))
idx <- which(df$rat_ideal < 1)
points(1/df[idx,1],1/df[idx,2],pch=19,cex=0.5,col='red')
```
#Comment

Ratio of a BS and DS point in images with and without folding. Red and Black points are from phases of the Moon on either side of half. The line is the 1:1 line. We see that the BS/DS ratio is always less in folded images than in ideal, un-folded images.
